title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon - Wikipedia
snippet: During his political career, Mélenchon crossed various tendencies of the French left, from Trotskyism in his youth to more moderate socialism, as he was in the Socialist Party for almost thirty years, occupying a place on the left wing of the party, before he began a companionship with the ...

title: La France Insoumise - Wikipedia
snippet: 'France Unbowed' or 'France in Revolt') is a left-wing political party in France. It was launched in 2016 by Jean-Luc Mélenchon, then a Member of the European Parliament (MEP) and former co-president of the Left Party (PG). It aims to implement the eco-socialist and democratic socialist programme ...

title: The Crisis Engulfing the French Left | The Nation
snippet: La France Insoumise (LFI) party leader Jean-Luc Melenchon (L) and French Socialist Party (PS) First Secretary Olivier Faure address supporters during a campaign meeting in Caen, France, on June 8, 2022.(Sameer Al-Doumy / AFP via Getty Images)

title: France’s Jean-luc Mélenchon announces a “New popular union” with the capitalist Socialist Party - World Socialist Web Site
snippet: By forming an alliance with the PS, a bourgeois party, Mélenchon is turning his back on the promises he made to his voters.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon facts for kids
snippet: In 1976, Mélenchon joined the Socialist Party. He quickly became involved in local politics. He was elected as a town councillor in Massy in 1983. In 1986, he was elected to the Senate, the upper house of the French parliament.
